story:
Once upon a time, in a small town nestled between the mountains and the sea, there lived a kind and generous Muslim family. The family consisted of a father, a mother, and their two children, a son named Ahmad and a daughter named Aisha.

Ahmad and Aisha were the best of friends, always looking out for each other and helping their parents in any way they could. They would help their mother with the household chores, assist their father in the garden, and even accompany him to the mosque for the daily prayers.

One day, their father told them a story about a magical bird that lived in the mountains. The bird was said to have the power to grant wishes to those who were pure of heart and mind. Ahmad and Aisha were fascinated by the story and begged their father to take them to the mountains to see the magical bird.

Their father agreed, and the next day, they set off on their journey. They climbed the steep trails, crossed the fast-flowing streams, and finally reached the top of the mountain where the magical bird was said to live.

As they looked around, they saw a beautiful bird with shimmering feathers of gold and silver. It was perched on a branch, singing a melodious tune. Ahmad and Aisha approached the bird cautiously, not wanting to scare it away.

The bird looked at them with its bright, intelligent eyes and spoke in a soft, gentle voice. "Why have you come here?" it asked.

Ahmad and Aisha looked at each other and then at their father. He nodded encouragingly, and Ahmad spoke up. "We have come to see the magical bird and to ask for its help," he said.

The bird tilted its head, listening intently. "What is it that you want?" it asked.

Ahmad and Aisha looked at each other and then at their father again. He smiled and nodded for them to speak their wishes.

Aisha spoke first. "I wish for peace and happiness for our family and for all the people in the world," she said.

The bird looked at Aisha with admiration. "That is a noble wish," it said. "I will grant it for you."

Ahmad thought for a moment and then spoke. "I wish for knowledge and wisdom, so that I can help others and make the world a better place," he said.

The bird looked at Ahmad with approval. "That is a wise wish," it said. "I will grant it for you."

And with that, the magical bird spread its wings and flew away, leaving behind a sense of peace and contentment in Ahmad, Aisha, and their father.

From that day forward, Ahmad and Aisha became even more kind and generous, always looking for ways to help others and make the world a better place. They continued to live happily with their parents, knowing that they had been blessed by the magical bird of the mountains.

And so, my dear child, always remember to be kind and generous like Ahmad and Aisha, and may Allah bless you with peace, happiness, knowledge, and wisdom. Good night and sweet dreams.
